from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
import json
orchestration_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/orchestration_test.json", wholetext=True).first().value
json_config_dict = json.loads(orchestration_json)
[obje for obje in json_config_dict["definitions"] if obje["Source_ID"]==1]

### get json schema for outstanding files table 
### expected_datetime | Folderpath | Filename_Format | Filename_Date_Format
## #create_table_from_schema(jsonschema:str, db_name:str, table_name:str, target_container:str, target_folder:str)

### process cron dates
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
# from zoneinfo import ZoneInfo tz=ZoneInfo("Europe/London")
time_now = datetime(2022,11,7)

definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
for defs in definitions:
    cronstart = defs['Completion_Frequency_CRON']
    deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays'])

    from croniter import croniter
    iter_start = croniter(cronstart, time_now)
    last_start_dt = iter_start.get_prev(datetime)
    
    next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays)

    # if time_now.weekday() > 1 
    if last_start_dt < time_now < next_end_dt:
        print(next_end_dt)

def read_schedule():
    '''
    Function reads all the schedules for all files, and processes any new files into standardised, and adds old files into an outstanding files table
    '''
    ### add parameter for adhoc processing - ignore scheduling - 
    ### do we need something that flags modified files?
    
    ### LOADS JSON
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    import json
    orchestration_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/orchestration_test.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    json_config_dict = json.loads(orchestration_json)
    
    ### ITERATE THROUGH ALL JSON
    ### process cron dates
    from datetime import datetime, timedelta
    # from zoneinfo import ZoneInfo tz=ZoneInfo("Europe/London")
    time_now = datetime(2022,11,7)

    definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
    for defs in definitions:
        cronstart = defs['Completion_Frequency_CRON']
        deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays'])

        from croniter import croniter
        iter_start = croniter(cronstart, time_now)
        last_start_dt = iter_start.get_prev(datetime)
        
        next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays)
    
        ### IS FILE EXPECTED RIGHT NOW?
        # weekdays handling
        # if time_now.weekday() > 1 
        if last_start_dt < time_now < next_end_dt:
            print(next_end_dt)

    

    ### HAS THE FILE BEEN INGESTED ---> REFACTOR STANDARDISED TO INCLUDE NEW PROCESS_DATE COLUMN
    create_standardised_tables()
